oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Control strategies against cherry and olive fruit flies: past and perspectives
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Warlop, F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Here is shown the passed and current research focus of GRAB to limit infestations of olive and cherry fruit flies. Different techniques are discussed, assessed worldwide, and some others are being developped, which care about environment richness, like ground fauna as efficient predators of overwintering pupae.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Warlop, F. (2003) Control strategies against cherry and olive fruit flies: past and perspectives. In: Proceedings of Journ√©es Techniques GRAB-ITAB. [Unpublished]
